tool.name: Unzip Collection
tool.help:
**What is does:**
This tool takes a paired collection and "unzips" it into two simple dataset collections (lists of datasets).
----
**Example**:
Given a paired collection of forward and reverse reads this tool will "unzip" it into two collections containing forward and reverse reads, respectively::
Paired Collection +-------------------+ | +---------------+ | | | +-----------+ | | | | | forward | | | | | +-----------+ | | | | +-----------+ | | | | | reverse | | | +---- | | +-----------+ | | ----+ | | +---------------+ | | | | +---------------+ | | | | | +-----------+ | | | | | | | forward | | | | | | | +-----------+ | | | | | | +-----------+ | | | | | | | reverse | | | | | | | +-----------+ | | | | | +---------------+ | | | +-------------------+ | ↓ ↓
Collection 1 Collection 2 +---------------+ +---------------+ | +-----------+ | | +-----------+ | | | forward | | | | reverse | | | +-----------+ | | +-----------+ | | +-----------+ | | +-----------+ | | | forward | | | | reverse | | | +-----------+ | | +-----------+ | +---------------+ +---------------+
.. class:: infomark
This tool will create new history datasets from your collection but your quota usage will not increase.
